msgSnippet: Swing UI, AWT UI and Text UI s run method implementation are not exactly the same in JUnit. The only documented way of doing it is to make these runner classes

Swing UI, AWT UI and Text UI's run method implementation are not exactly the same in JUnit.

The only documented way of doing it is to make these runner classes as the main class to run and pass the name of the test class
(testcase or testsuite) as the argument.

You can sort of having a work around by calling the main method of these runners and pass the test class name a string array.

Shane

infosuresh@... wrote:

> HAI ALL,
>
> I am getting a GUI output for this command:-
> junit.swingui.TestRunner.run(StackTest.class);
>
> I am NOT getting GUI output for this commmand:-
>   junit.swingui.TestRunner.run(suite());
>
> Can anyone explain why this is so...?
> Should I include some other statements apart from
> import junit.framework.*;
> Please explain.
>
> thank you
> Suresh
